Title: ‘We Are Not Equipped to Deal With This’: Migrant Surge Overwhelms U.S. Border
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/27/world/americas/mexico-border-migration-arizona.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-27 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: At a remote spot in the Arizona desert, near a hole in the border wall, dozens of migrants huddled over wood fires.
  After fleeing war in Sudan, violent gangs in Central America or Mexican cartels, the men had all crossed into the United States illegally, walked on foot over rugged terrain for hours, and arrived at this outpost exhausted, hungry and cold.
  They wanted to turn themselves into the authorities to ask for asylum, but were stranded here, miles away from the closest town, Sásabe.
- Source
  Title: ‘We Are Not Equipped to Deal With This’: Migrant Surge Overwhelms U.S. Border
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/27/world/americas/mexico-border-migration-arizona.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-27 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Then, as temperatures dropped on Tuesday night, a convoy of Border Patrol agents rolled in, loaded the men into a van to be processed and sped away — off to search for more people in need of rescue.
- Source
  Title: Blinken Meets With Mexico’s President About Surge in Migration at the Border
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/27/us/politics/blinken-mexico-migrant-caravan.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-27 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: President Biden dispatched the officials to Mexico City at a pivotal moment, as border crossings have hit record numbers and there is growing pressure on Mr. Biden to solve — or at least contain — a crisis that has proved to be a consistent political vulnerability.
- Source
  Title: Blinken Meets With Mexico’s President About Surge in Migration at the Border
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/27/us/politics/blinken-mexico-migrant-caravan.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-27 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: President Biden dispatched the officials to Mexico City at a pivotal moment, as border crossings have hit record numbers and there is growing pressure on Mr. Biden to solve — or at least contain — a crisis that has proved to be a consistent political vulnerability.

Your answer to the question here.

Cite all Possible sources and put each on a new line.
If you don't have the relevent information to answer the question or a source,
tell the user so.  Err on the side of caution.

If the question or topic is off topic and not about news at all, tell the user so.

Here is the question: US mexico border crisis
output:
The recent surge of migrants overwhelming the U.S. border has led to a critical situation in the Arizona desert. Dozens of migrants, including those fleeing war in Sudan, violence from Central American gangs, or Mexican cartels, have crossed into the United States illegally. After walking on foot over rugged terrain for hours, they arrived at a remote outpost exhausted, hungry, and cold. Stranded miles away from the closest town, Sásabe, they sought to turn themselves in to authorities for asylum. Border Patrol agents intervened, loading the men into a van for processing as temperatures dropped. This incident highlights the challenges faced by migrants and the strain on resources at the U.S. border. In response to the escalating situation, President Biden dispatched officials to Mexico City to address the surge in migration and growing political pressure to find a resolution.

Sources:
['‘We Are Not Equipped to Deal With This’: Migrant Surge Overwhelms U.S. Border,' The New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/27/world/americas/mexico-border-migration-arizona.html, Publish Date: 2023-12-27]
['Blinken Meets With Mexico’s President About Surge in Migration at the Border,' The New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/27/us/politics/blinken-mexico-migrant-caravan.html, Publish Date: 2023-12-27]

  But defining what counts as “clean” turned out to be contentious.

Here is the question: Hydrogen tex credits
output:
The Biden administration has issued a long-awaited plan to provide lucrative tax breaks to companies producing hydrogen, a clean-burning fuel. The tax credit, approved by Congress last year, aims to incentivize the production of hydrogen from renewable energy and other carbon-free sources. The credit provides up to $3 for every kilogram of 'clean' hydrogen produced over a decade. However, defining what qualifies as 'clean' has been a point of contention, leading to fierce lobbying by businesses. The Biden administration's plan includes new rules to ensure that the policy does not inadvertently result in a spike in planet-warming emissions. The issue is crucial for jump-starting the hydrogen industry while avoiding unintended environmental consequences.

Sources:
['A Lucrative Tax Credit for Making Clean Fuel Won’t Be So Easy to Get,' The New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/22/climate/hydrogen-tax-credits.html, Publish Date: 2023-12-22]

Title: The Year in Climate Culture
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/the-year-in-climate-culture.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-21 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Not coincidentally, it was also a year when climate change started to feel ubiquitous in popular culture. Glossy TV shows, best-selling books, art exhibits and even pop music tackled the subject, often with the kind of nuance and creativity that can help us make sense of the world’s thorniest issues.
  Here are some highlights from the year in climate culture.
- Source
  Title: The Year in Climate Culture
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/the-year-in-climate-culture.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-21 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: 2023 was a year when climate change felt inescapable. Whether it was the raging wildfires in Canada, the orange skies in New York, the flash floods in Libya or the searing heat in China, the effects of our overheating planet were too severe to ignore.
- Source
  Title: The Year in Climate Culture
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/the-year-in-climate-culture.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-21 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: (And please share your own recommendations with us by filling out this short form. Your contributions may be featured in an upcoming newsletter.)
  Books
  “The Deluge” by Stephen Markley
  This bracing and beguiling novel tracks a cadre of radicalized scientists and activists from the gathering storm of the Obama years to the super-typhoons of the 2040s. Hamilton Cain, the Times book reviewer, writes: “The dystopia is realistic and nuanced, grim but playful, setting Markley’s book apart from the tsunami of recent climate-change literature.”
- Source
  Title: Share the Climate-Related Pop Culture That Stuck With You
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/share-climate-related-pop-culture-2023.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-21 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: 2023: a year when climate change felt inescapable, and a year when climate change started to feel ubiquitous in popular culture. In this week’s Climate Forward newsletter, we listed the climate culture pieces that resonated with us.
  Now, we want to hear from you. Which works of climate-related pop culture from this year made an impact on you? Books, films, songs, performances, TikTok videos, paintings and more are all fair game.
- Source
  Title: Share the Climate-Related Pop Culture That Stuck With You
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/share-climate-related-pop-culture-2023.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-21 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: We might use what you share with us as part of an upcoming newsletter that lists our readers’ recommendations. We won’t share your response with anyone outside our newsroom or use your contact information beyond following up with you. And we won’t publish your submission without first contacting you to verify that your information and response are accurate.

Here is the question: Climate change culture
output:
In 2023, climate change became a pervasive topic in popular culture, with various forms of media addressing the subject. TV shows, books, art exhibits, and even pop music explored climate change with nuance and creativity. The year marked a time when the impacts of climate change, such as wildfires in Canada, orange skies in New York, flash floods in Libya, and intense heat in China, felt unavoidable. Notably, 'The Deluge' by Stephen Markley, a novel tracking radicalized scientists and activists amidst climate challenges, received recognition for its realistic and nuanced portrayal. The New York Times sought recommendations from readers on climate-related pop culture that left an impact, inviting suggestions across various mediums like books, films, songs, performances, TikTok videos, and paintings.

Sources:
['The Year in Climate Culture,' The New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/the-year-in-climate-culture.html, Publish Date: 2023-12-21]
['Share the Climate-Related Pop Culture That Stuck With You,' The New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/21/climate/share-climate-related-pop-culture-2023.html, Publish Date: 2023-12-21]

Title: These Vets Make House Calls for Killer Whales
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/26/science/orcas-killer-whales-veterinarians.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-26 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: It’s not easy to perform a veterinary exam on a wild, multi-ton marine mammal that might surface for only seconds at a time. But for the last five years, a team of veterinarians, marine biologists and engineers has been developing tools to do just that. Their goal is to perform regular, remote health assessments on each of the Southern Residents — and, if necessary, to intervene with personalized medical care.
- Source
  Title: These Vets Make House Calls for Killer Whales
  Url: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/26/science/orcas-killer-whales-veterinarians.html
  Publish Date: 2023-12-26 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: One day last September, a team of scientists clambered onto a small boat and set out into the Salish Sea, searching for an endangered population of orcas. The Southern Resident killer whales, one of several distinct orca communities that inhabit the Pacific Northwest, can be elusive, so the researchers were delighted to find a small pod of them. But as they drew closer, a putrid smell washed over the boat.

Your answer to the question here.

If you don't have the relevent information to answer the question or a source,
tell the user so.  Err on the side of caution.

If the question or topic is off topic and not about news at all, tell the user so.

Here is the question: What are orca veterinarians?
output:
A team of veterinarians, marine biologists, and engineers has been working for the last five years on tools to perform veterinary exams on Southern Resident killer whales. The aim is to conduct regular, remote health assessments on these wild marine mammals. The team is equipped to intervene with personalized medical care if necessary. In a specific instance last September, the scientists, aboard a small boat in the Salish Sea, encountered an endangered population of orcas, the Southern Resident killer whales, during their search. The veterinarians are adapting to the challenge of examining these elusive, multi-ton marine mammals that surface for only seconds at a time.

Sources:
['These Vets Make House Calls for Killer Whales,' The New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/26/science/orcas-killer-whales-veterinarians.html, Publish Date: 2023-12-26]

Here is the question: Ozempic drug weight loss
output:
The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has announced the seizure of thousands of units of counterfeit Ozempic, a diabetes drug widely used for weight loss. The FDA warns that some fraudulent Ozempic products may still be circulating in the market. This development highlights concerns about the availability of counterfeit medications and potential risks to public health.

Title: Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized nearly a week after experiencing ‘medical complication’
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/entertainment/jamie-foxx-remains-hospitalized/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: CNN reported Friday that Foxx was hospitalized and undergoing medical tests.

Foxx has been in Atlanta filming the Netflix movie “Back in Action” with Cameron Diaz. The source previously told CNN that the medical incident did not happen on set and Foxx was not transported by emergency vehicle to the hospital.

A separate source close to production on the film told CNN on Friday that filming is “currently underway” and is expected to wrap up this week.
- Source
  Title: Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized nearly a week after experiencing ‘medical complication’
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/entertainment/jamie-foxx-remains-hospitalized/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: This source did not elaborate as to whether Foxx still has scenes to film or whether he would be back on set.

CNN has reached out to representatives for Foxx for comment.
- Source
  Title: Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized nearly a week after experiencing ‘medical complication’
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/entertainment/jamie-foxx-remains-hospitalized/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: CNN —

Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized in Georgia nearly a week after his daughter revealed the actor experienced a “medical complication,” a source with knowledge of the matter told CNN on Monday.

His daughter Corinne Foxx shared on Instagram last week that her father had experienced a health-related incident last Tuesday, though she did not specify what occurred. She added in her post that due to “quick action and great care,” her father is “on his way to recovery.”

Here is the question: Jamie Foxx in hospital
output:
Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized in Georgia nearly a week after his daughter revealed that he experienced a 'medical complication.' The exact nature of the incident has not been disclosed. Foxx, who is in Atlanta filming the Netflix movie 'Back in Action' with Cameron Diaz, did not experience the medical issue on set, and it was not an emergency transport to the hospital. His daughter, Corinne Foxx, shared on Instagram that her father is 'on his way to recovery' due to 'quick action and great care.' Filming for the movie is reportedly 'currently underway.' For further details or updates, CNN has reached out to representatives for Jamie Foxx.

Sources:
['Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized nearly a week after experiencing ‘medical complication',' CNN, https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/entertainment/jamie-foxx-remains-hospitalized/index.html, Publish Date: 2023-04-17]

Title: Apple announces ‘scary fast’ October event
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/24/tech/apple-october-event-2023/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-10-24 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Apple (AAPL) launched its first in-house M1 silicon chipset for its computer lineup in 2020, shifting away from years of using a one-size-fits-all option from Intel. At the time, Apple (AAPL) claimed it was the world’s fastest CPU core and fastest integrated graphics in a personal computer.

Last month, Apple unveiled its iPhone 15 devices with a slimmer design, a more-advanced main camera system, a customizable Action button, and USB-C charging.
- Source
  Title: Apple announces ‘scary fast’ October event
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/24/tech/apple-october-event-2023/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-10-24 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: “Weak demand, excess inventory, and a worsening macroeconomic climate were all contributing factors for the precipitous drop in shipments of traditional PCs,” market research firm IDC said earlier this year.

Last year, Apple brought its M2 chip to its MacBook line. The 24-inch iMac is expected to get the M3 chip at Apple’s event this year. At this point, there are no rumors of a new iPad launch.
- Source
  Title: Apple announces ‘scary fast’ October event
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/24/tech/apple-october-event-2023/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-10-24 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: CNN —

Apple announced its second product event of the season, a month after introducing its new iPhone 15 lineup. New iMacs are likely.

The company sent invitations to members of the media for a scheduled keynote on Monday, October 30 at 8:00 p.m. ET/5:00 p.m. PT, later than it typically kicks off events. It will be accessible via livestream only; Apple usually hosts its product launches both in person and online.
- Source
  Title: Apple announces ‘scary fast’ October event
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/24/tech/apple-october-event-2023/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-10-24 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: The tagline for the event – “scary fast” – is an apparent nod to the likely unveiling of its next-generation silicon chip, M3, as well as Halloween. The company is expected to show off new iMac computers boasting the new powerful chipset in a move that should also boost Mac sales. Mac sales have been down this year.
- Source
  Title: India targets Apple over its phone hacking notifications
  Url: https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/12/27/india-apple-iphone-hacking/
  Publish Date: 2023-12-27 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Senior Modi administration officials called Apple India’s managing director, Virat Bhatia, after the news broke, said two people with knowledge of the matter. One of the people said Indian officials asked Apple to withdraw the warnings and say it had made a mistake. After a heated discussion, the company’s India office said the most it could do was put out a public statement that emphasized certain caveats that Apple had already listed on its tech support page about the warnings.
- Source
  Title: India targets Apple over its phone hacking notifications
  Url: https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/12/27/india-apple-iphone-hacking/

One of the people said Indian officials asked Apple to withdraw the warnings and say it had made a mistake. Your answer to the question here.

If the question or topic is off topic and not about news at all, tell the user so.

Here is the question: Apple company news
output:
Apple has announced its 'scary fast' October event, scheduled for Monday, October 30 at 8:00 p.m. ET/5:00 p.m. PT. The event will be accessible via livestream only. The tagline 'scary fast' suggests the likely unveiling of Apple's next-generation silicon chip, M3, with new iMac computers expected to feature the powerful chipset. This comes a month after the introduction of the iPhone 15 lineup. The M2 chip was introduced to Apple's MacBook line last year, and the 24-inch iMac is anticipated to receive the M3 chip at this event. The event is likely to boost Mac sales, which have seen a decline this year. In a separate development, India has targeted Apple over its phone hacking notifications, with senior Modi administration officials urging Apple to withdraw the warnings and issue a statement acknowledging a mistake. However, Apple's India office stated that the most it could do was release a public statement emphasizing caveats already listed on its tech support page about the warnings.

Sources:
['Apple announces ‘scary fast’ October event,' CNN, https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/24/tech/apple-october-event-2023/index.html, Publish Date: 2023-10-24]
['India targets Apple over its phone hacking notifications,' The Washington Post, https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/12/27/india-apple-iphone-hacking/, Publish Date: 2023-12-27]

- Source
  Title: Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: “Our modeling approach does not prove causation, and our findings should be considered as estimates of risk,” the authors wrote.
- Source
  Title: Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Too many processed foods

Mozaffarian and his team developed a research model of dietary intake between 1990 and 2018 and applied it to 184 countries. Compared with 1990, there were 8.6 million more cases of type 2 diabetes due to poor diet in 2018, the study found.
- Source
  Title: Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Another key factor: People are eating far too much red and processed meats, such as bacon, sausage, salami and the like, the study said. Those three factors — eating too few whole grains and too many processed grains and meats — were the primary drivers of over 14 million new cases of type 2 diabetes in 2018, according to the study, which was published Monday in the journal Nature Medicine.
- Source
  Title: Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: Researchers found eating too many unhealthy foods was more of a driver of type 2 diabetes on a global level than a lack of eating wholesome foods, especially for men compared with women, younger compared to older adults, and in urban versus rural residents.
- Source
  Title: Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: In fact, the study estimated 7 out of 10 cases of type 2 diabetes worldwide in 2018 were linked to poor food choices.

Unhealthy carbs and processed meats are two leading contributing factors to global cases of diabetes, a new study said. djgunner/E+/Getty Images

“These new findings reveal critical areas for national and global focus to improve nutrition and reduce devastating burdens of diabetes,” said Mozaffarian, who is also the editor in chief of the Tufts Health & Nutrition Letter.
- Source
  Title: Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
  Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html
  Publish Date: 2023-04-17 00:00:00
  Excerpt from source: “Our study suggests poor carbohydrate quality is a leading driver of diet-attributable type 2 diabetes globally,” says senior author Dr. Dariush Mozaffarian, a professor of nutrition at Tufts University and professor of medicine at Tufts School of Medicine in Boston, in a statement.

tell the user so.  Err on the side of caution.

If the question or topic is off topic and not about news at all, tell the user so.

Here is the question: Rise of type 2 diabetes
output:
A new study indicates that the global rise in type 2 diabetes is driven by factors such as refined carbs and meat consumption. The study, published in the journal Nature Medicine, suggests that poor carbohydrate quality is a leading driver of diet-attributable type 2 diabetes worldwide. The research model, applied to 184 countries between 1990 and 2018, estimated that compared to 1990, there were 8.6 million more cases of type 2 diabetes in 2018 due to poor diet. Over 14 million new cases in 2018 were primarily attributed to eating too few whole grains and too many processed grains and meats. The study emphasizes that unhealthy food choices, particularly the consumption of refined carbs and processed meats, contribute more to the global prevalence of type 2 diabetes than a lack of wholesome foods. The research highlights critical areas for national and global focus to improve nutrition and reduce the burden of diabetes.

Sources:
['Refined carbs and meat driving global rise in type 2 diabetes, study says,' CNN, https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/health/rise-type-2-diabetes-global-wellness/index.html, Publish Date: 2023-04-17]

  Excerpt from source: But the confrontation between Apple and the Modi administration this autumn was more delicate for both sides and ended in a stalemate, according to industry analysts and people working with Apple.

  Title: India targets Apple over its phone hacking notifications

Officials from the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) publicly questioned whether the Silicon Valley company’s internal threat algorithms were faulty and announced an investigation into the security of Apple devices.

Here is the question: India Apple Iphone
output:
In October, Apple warned independent Indian journalists and opposition party politicians that government hackers may have attempted to break into their iPhones. However, the Modi administration in India responded by questioning the reliability of Apple's internal threat algorithms and initiated an investigation into the security of Apple devices. The confrontation between Apple and the Modi administration ended in a stalemate, with Apple looking to India as a key revenue driver. Despite initial concerns raised by BJP officials, Apple reportedly ceded less ground than its Silicon Valley peers, and no new statement was issued after a November summit with Indian authorities.

Sources:
['India targets Apple over its phone hacking notifications,' The Washington Post, https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/12/27/india-apple-iphone-hacking/, Publish Date: 2023-12-27]

  Excerpt from source: Lee Sun-kyun, the award-winning South Korean actor who rose to international fame after starring in the Oscar-winning film “Parasite,” was found dead in Seoul on Wednesday. He was 48.

Here is the question: lee sun kyun Parisite actor suicide
output:
Lee Sun-kyun, the South Korean actor known for his role in the Oscar-winning film 'Parasite,' was found dead in Seoul at the age of 48. His death is being investigated by the police as a suicide. Lee had recently been under investigation for alleged illegal drug use, which he denied. Reports suggest that he died by suicide, and his agency, HODU&U Entertainment, confirmed his death, expressing deep grief and despair.

Sources:
